states

Class Playing

  • java.lang.Object
    • states.GameStates
      • states.Playing

  • public class Playing
extends GameStates
    This is the class that all the actual game information, everything that happens on the screen when the game is running is defined here.
    Author:
    Eder Paz ; Neil Blake ; Logan Wedel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Playing(Game game)
      Creates a new instance of all objects and instantiate the game object passed to it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the player score and life on the screen.
      Call the render() method of all objects in the game state.
      void tick()
      Generates random and automatically all the objects that cross the screen according to time.
      Keeps track of and updates the player score.
      Calls the tick() methods of all the object of the game state.

      • Methods inherited from class states.GameStates

        changeState, getState, setChangeState, setState

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Playing

        public Playing(Game game)
        Creates a new instance of all objects and instantiate the game object passed to it.
        Parameters:
        game - Game instance so that the game state can rely on the game variables.

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Generates random and automatically all the objects that cross the screen according to time.
        Keeps track of and updates the player score.
        Calls the tick() methods of all the object of the game state.
        Specified by:
        tick in class GameStates

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the player score and life on the screen.
        Call the render() method of all objects in the game state.
        Specified by:
        render in class GameStates
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object used to draw images on the screen.
